clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial on the Effect on Low Back Pain Related Disability of Different Health Education Programs for Retired Persons
clinical_study.official_title: Controlled Randomized Clinical Trial on the Effect on Low Back Pain Related Disability of Different Health Education Programs for Retired Persons

collaborator.agency: Conseill Insular de Ibiza y Formentera

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to compare, in retired persons living in the Balearic Islands, the effectiveness on low back pain related disability of three educational programs. All consist of a group talk and the handout of a booklet, each one different in its content.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Pilot study showed recruitment rates were lower than expected,and number of losses to follow-up, much higher.

primary_outcome.measure: Intensity of pain, measured at baseline, 30, and 180 days
Disability, measured at baseline, 30, and 180 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Fear avoidance beliefs, measured at baseline, 30, and 180 days
Quality of life, measured at baseline, 30, and 180 days

arm_group.description: Education on postural hygiene and handout of The Back Guide
Education on active management and handout of The Back Book
Education on cardiovascular and general health

intervention.description: Education on postural hygiene and handout of The Back Guide
Education on active management and Handout of The Back Book
Education on cardiovascular and general health

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- To attend regular talks for retirees, and accept to attend one health talk, whether or not subject has nonspecific low back pain; to accept participation in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to fill out questionnaires (due to blindness, functional illiteracy, or dementia);
- Having a diagnosis of rheumatologic inflammatory disease, fibromyalgia, or cancer in last 5 years.
